name: happy-hour-who-puts-the-town-in-town-hall
title: Happy Hour: Who Puts The “Town” In Town Hall?
author: Christy Frink
contentEncoded:
• The word from Belmont on the presidential debate hasn’t changed much–there’s still no room for us and we’re not getting in, but they have unveiled an invite-only viewing party at the Ryman for which we also probably probably won’t be able to get tickets. [WTVF]
  • Nashville-based Bridgestone Tire totally dissed Murfreesboro when they decided to build the new technical center in Akron, OH instead. [Tennessean]
  • Former Titan Erron Kinney has moved onto a not-so-new career working with the Brentwood Fire Department as a firefighter. He’s worked with various fire departments since the age of 13, but took a brief intermission for football. He received his badge on Monday. [Tennessean]
  • Having exhausted every other option, people are starting to actually pray for lower gas prices. They say it must worth it since, you know, the prices are starting to come back down. [WSMV]
